--- In gladiator@y..., johnnyoldschool@e... wrote:
> what i mean by legitimate levels are the levels that come with the 
> game. the reason i use the word "legitimate" is because those levels 
> came with the game and are presumed to be conquerable by normal 
> characters (i.e. without cheating). as player-created level 
> difficulty escalates, legitimacy is compromised. for example, level 
> 390 in the tevfifty set i found utterly impossible to beat, even 
with 
> BLATANT cheating. some of your (dph) levels were also 
extraordinarily 
> difficult to beat without cheating for a certain team (elf and 
> cleric). i have taken many teams through the "legitimate" (first 
> fifty levels) and never felt the slightest inclination to cheat.
> 
> THAT'S what i mean by legitimate.. no offense meant

No offense taken.  I went through all the built-in scenarios first, 
then through the tevififty with a legitimate team.  Then I took that 
team and used to test my way through my own 'normal' scenarios.  
[Anything in my "torture" set I did not consider normal.]  A 100% 
legitimate was able to go through all those scenarios.  I did not 
freeze time to beat any scenarios.  I also kept my summoning of fire 
elementals to a minimum except for "The Slime Lords" to get a feel for 
being overwhelmed.
